trans-unit.source: CDN - Restrict access to your content by country
trans-unit.target: CDN - Restrict access to your content by country

trans-unit.source: When a user requests your content, by default, the content is served regardless of where the user made this request from.
trans-unit.target: When a user requests your content, by default, the content is served regardless of where the user made this request from.

trans-unit.source: In some cases, you may want to restrict access to your content by country.
trans-unit.target: In some cases, you may want to restrict access to your content by country.

trans-unit.source: This topic explains how to use the **Country Filtering** feature in order to configure the service to allow or block access by country.
trans-unit.target: This topic explains how to use the **Country Filtering** feature in order to configure the service to allow or block access by country.

trans-unit.source: Restrict access to your content by country
trans-unit.target: Restrict access to your content by country

trans-unit.source: When a user requests your content, by default, the content is served regardless of where the user made this request from.
trans-unit.target: When a user requests your content, by default, the content is served regardless of where the user made this request from.

trans-unit.source: In some cases, you may want to restrict access to your content by country.
trans-unit.target: In some cases, you may want to restrict access to your content by country.

trans-unit.source: This topic explains how to use the **Country Filtering** feature in order to configure the service to allow or block access by country.
trans-unit.target: This topic explains how to use the **Country Filtering** feature in order to configure the service to allow or block access by country.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE]Once the configuration is set up, it will apply to all CDN endpoints in your subscription.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE]Once the configuration is set up, it will apply to all CDN endpoints in your subscription.

trans-unit.source: For information about considerations that apply to configuring this type of restrictions, see the [Considerations](cdn-restrict-access-by-country.md#considerations) section at the end of the topic.
trans-unit.target: For information about considerations that apply to configuring this type of restrictions, see the [Considerations](cdn-restrict-access-by-country.md#considerations) section at the end of the topic.

trans-unit.source: Country filtering
trans-unit.target: Country filtering

trans-unit.source: Step 1: Define the directory path
trans-unit.target: Step 1: Define the directory path

trans-unit.source: When configuring a country filter, you must specify the relative path to the location to which users will be allowed or denied access.
trans-unit.target: When configuring a country filter, you must specify the relative path to the location to which users will be allowed or denied access.

trans-unit.source: You can apply country filtering for all your files with "/" or selected folders by specifying directory paths.
trans-unit.target: You can apply country filtering for all your files with "/" or selected folders by specifying directory paths.

trans-unit.source: Example directory path filter:
trans-unit.target: Example directory path filter:

trans-unit.source: Step 2: Define the action: block or allow
trans-unit.target: Step 2: Define the action: block or allow

trans-unit.source: **Block:** Users from the specified countries will be denied access to assets requested from that recursive path.
trans-unit.target: **Block:** Users from the specified countries will be denied access to assets requested from that recursive path.

trans-unit.source: If no other country filtering options have been configured for that location, then all other users will be allowed access.
trans-unit.target: If no other country filtering options have been configured for that location, then all other users will be allowed access.

trans-unit.source: **Allow:** Only users from the specified countries will be allowed access to assets requested from that recursive path.
trans-unit.target: **Allow:** Only users from the specified countries will be allowed access to assets requested from that recursive path.

trans-unit.source: Step 3: Define the countries
trans-unit.target: Step 3: Define the countries

trans-unit.source: Select the countries that you want to block or allow for the path.
trans-unit.target: Select the countries that you want to block or allow for the path.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see the [Country codes](cdn-country-codes.md) topic.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see the [Country codes](cdn-country-codes.md) topic.

trans-unit.source: For example, the rule of blocking /Photos/Strasbourg/ will filter files including:
trans-unit.target: For example, the rule of blocking /Photos/Strasbourg/ will filter files including:

trans-unit.source: Country codes
trans-unit.target: Country codes

trans-unit.source: The **Country Filtering** feature uses country codes to define the countries from which a request will be allowed or blocked for a secured directory.
trans-unit.target: The **Country Filtering** feature uses country codes to define the countries from which a request will be allowed or blocked for a secured directory.

trans-unit.source: You will find the country codes in [this](cdn-country-codes.md) topic.
trans-unit.target: You will find the country codes in [this](cdn-country-codes.md) topic.

trans-unit.source: If you specify “EU” (Europe) or "AP" (Asia/Pacific), a subset of IP addresses that originate from any country in that regions will be blocked or allowed.
trans-unit.target: If you specify “EU” (Europe) or "AP" (Asia/Pacific), a subset of IP addresses that originate from any country in that regions will be blocked or allowed.

trans-unit.source: Considerations
trans-unit.target: Considerations

trans-unit.source: It may take up to an hour for changes to your country filtering configuration to take effect.
trans-unit.target: It may take up to an hour for changes to your country filtering configuration to take effect.

trans-unit.source: This feature does not support wildcard characters (for example, ‘*’).
trans-unit.target: This feature does not support wildcard characters (for example, ‘*’).

trans-unit.source: The country filtering configuration associated with the relative path will be applied recursively to that path.
trans-unit.target: The country filtering configuration associated with the relative path will be applied recursively to that path.

trans-unit.source: Only one rule can be applied to the same relative path (you cannot create multiple country filters that point to the same relative path.
trans-unit.target: Only one rule can be applied to the same relative path (you cannot create multiple country filters that point to the same relative path.

trans-unit.source: However, a folder may have multiple country filters.
trans-unit.target: However, a folder may have multiple country filters.

trans-unit.source: This is due to the recursive nature of country filters.
trans-unit.target: This is due to the recursive nature of country filters.

trans-unit.source: In other words, a subfolder of a previously configured folder can be assigned a different country filter.
trans-unit.target: In other words, a subfolder of a previously configured folder can be assigned a different country filter.

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
